item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SNOW is coming...Winter Gear Needed on FRIDAY

Call out for winter gear!! It is gonna be freezing cold and snow on Sunday and Monday. With all the sweeps lately many people have lost their gear and have nothing. Proper gear can be a matter of life and death.
Please donate the following to our office ON FRIDAY (10/23) anytime between 9am and 5pm. We will not be in the office on Saturday so please bring it by Friday so it can get to people in need.
(Or give it directly to someo...ne in need.)
-Tents ($25)*
-Tarps ($6)
-Sleeping Bags ($30)
-Blankets ($20)
-Handwarmers ($6)
-Good gloves ($15)

*All prices listed are average price at Walmart. Also you can get these at a thrift store for cheep.

(We do not have storage capacity for clothes, so please only bring winter gear...not lots of clothes - other places will take clothes).

Bring items to the DHOL office (2260 California St Denver CO) THIS Friday 9am to 5pm
Feel free to call us at 720-940-5291
Or give items directly to people on the streets who need these things

Living without a house in the winter requires this protection. Your gifts of gear save people's lives.

Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

item.title: Sweep of Encampment at 22nd and Wazee on Tuesday 10/27 Block to...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweep of Encampment at 22nd and Wazee on Tuesday 10/27
Block to Block to Block… This is the Cities answer to Homelessness


Next week’s game of homeless whack-a-mole is planned for 22nd and Wazee on Tuesday. This is an encampment that only had a few residents until after the sweep at 20th and Blake a few weeks ago and now has many residents who moved there from other sweeps. If anyone thinks these sweeps “connect people with resources” just look to this camp as an example an...d think again.

Moving people who have nowhere to go with no answer does not work. It is time we start using our brains and our hearts, instead of continuing this shameful whack-a-mole.

Contact City Council to ask for support for our budget proposals for housing and sanitation resources. https://denverhomelessoutloud.org/…/denver-budget-proposal…/

Please come and support our unhoused community members at 22nd and Wazee as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water
Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

item.title: Threat of Sweep at Blair-Caldwell Library Using Arbitrary Fire...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Threat of Sweep at Blair-Caldwell Library Using Arbitrary Fire Codes

The fire department posted an order on the wall of Blair-Caldwell Library where about 50+ houseless people have been living for months. Many people have been living here for months with the agreement of the Library. They have been working collaboratively with the Library to keep the area clean and safe. In recent weeks more people have moved here after being swept from other nearby encampments. Instead of wo...rking with new residents of this area on maintaining the space, the fire department has been sent to attempt to lump all residents in the same boat and kick everyone out. The fire department specifically quotes two issues that need resolved: combustible materials near the windows, and maintaining clear passage of the egress. These issues are both resolvable while residents of tents continue to live there.

In fact, only weeks ago this very location was approved by the fire department for a SOS site (tent camp). The current residents of this area should be held to the same fire safety standards as the approved SOS camp - not indiscriminately evicted regardless of their compliance with fire code.

Come down to Blair-Caldwell Library tomorrow morning (Tuesday 10/20) to ensure residents are treated in accordance to fair codes and not displaced even when they are following these codes.

item.title: City STEALS Port-a-potties from Houseless Encampments!@#$ ...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

City STEALS Port-a-potties from Houseless Encampments!@#$

We have just learned that the City, under Denver Department of Public Health and Environment (DDPHE), is actively having the port-a-potties we have placed at encampments, where people without housing live, removed. They have done this multiple times involving multiple units. They also have orders placed to move the remaining units, without notifying us.

These are the very units you as a community, donated money fo...r though a fundraiser we ran to support the cost of these units through the rest of 2020!!!

They are doing this in spite of CDC guidance, which asks cities to leave encampments in place to help prevent the spread of Covid and to provide port-a-potties to all encampments. Instead the city continually puts the rest of the city at risk by moving these encampments from place to place and now stealing the port-a-potties we put there!@#

They claim these units are unsanitary. Have you seen the city sponsored equivalents? They are in far worse sanitary condition.

Contact DDPHE Matt Wilmes - matthew.wilmes@denvergov.org or 720-865-6880

1) Demand that DDPHE cease this theft of port-a-potties WE have paid for.

2) Contact your Council person with the same demand.

3) Ask for a written response back.
